intro: Senecio cremnicola, commonly known as the Cape snowdrop, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in a cluster that resembles a snowdrop, giving it its common name. Senecio cremnicola is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
